synsets.definition: An overpowering internal force that compels action against one's rational judgment; from Arabic taghallub (overwhelming dominance) and qahr (subjugation by force), Germanic zwang (coercive pressure), and French contrainte (constraint)

Pathological craving or clinging that creates suffering through inability to let go; from Buddhist tanha (thirst/craving), Japanese shūchaku (obsessive attachment), Sanskrit asakti (unhealthy attachment), and Portuguese apego (compulsive clinging)

Culturally-recognized states of compulsive behavior driven by spiritual or psychological possession; from Algonquian wendigo (cannibalistic compulsion), Korean piroegam (exhaustion-driven compulsion), Arabic majnun (madness from obsessive love), Spanish locura (pathological obsession), and Native American ghost sickness (compulsive behavior from spiritual imbalance)
